required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Transvaginal Ultrasound Training for Obstetrics and Gynecology Residents
clinical_study.official_title: Transvaginal Ultrasound Training for the Obstetrics and Gynecology Resident: A Multi-Site Randomized Controlled Trial of Educational DVD

collaborator.agency: The Reading Hospital and Medical Center

brief_summary.textblock: Obstetrics and gynecology residents are deemed to be proficient in transvaginal ultrasound (TVUS) upon graduation from an accredited program, although TVUS education in residency is not standardized. The objective of this study is to assess for improvement in transvaginal ultrasound knowledge among residents after viewing an educational DVD.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a multi-site prospective parallel randomized controlled trial using an educational DVD from the American Institute of Ultrasound in Medicine, "Gynecology: Beginners Only"®, compared to routine education. All participants completed a pretest on transvaginal ultrasound images and principles. The intervention group repeated the test after viewing the DVD. During the trial, performing and logging transvaginal ultrasounds were encouraged. All enrolled residents repeated the test at 6-10 months after intervention.

primary_outcome.measure: Difference in Pre and Post Study Mean Test Scores

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in Pre and Post Viewing Mean Test Scores
Difference in Number of Post-Study Logged Transvaginal Ultrasounds
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 2 years

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean test score differences in specific question types (images and principles)
Difference in mean scores on "orange cards"

arm_group.description: These residents received their standard residency education and experience.
These residents received a one-hour long DVD lecture in addition to standard residency education and experience.

intervention.description: American Institute of Ultrasound in Medicine, "Gynecology: Beginners Only"®

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- resident in obstetrics and gynecology at one of three sites
Exclusion Criteria:
- unable to consent

reference.citation: Goldstein SR. Accreditation, certification: why all the confusion? Obstet Gynecol. 2007 Dec;110(6):1396-8.

Chao C, Chalouhi GE, Bouhanna P, Ville Y, Dommergues M. Randomized Clinical Trial of Virtual Reality Simulation Training for Transvaginal Gynecologic Ultrasound Skills. J Ultrasound Med. 2015 Sep;34(9):1663-7. doi: 10.7863/ultra.15.14.09063. Epub 2015 Aug 17.

Tolsgaard MG, Ringsted C, Dreisler E, Nørgaard LN, Petersen JH, Madsen ME, Freiesleben NL, Sørensen JL, Tabor A. Sustained effect of simulation-based ultrasound training on clinical performance: a randomized trial. Ultrasound Obstet Gynecol. 2015 Sep;46(3):312-8. doi: 10.1002/uog.14780. Epub 2015 Aug 6.

Carolan-Rees G, Ray AF. The ScanTrainer obstetrics and gynaecology ultrasound virtual reality training simulator: A cost model to determine the cost viability of replacing clinical training with simulation training. Ultrasound. 2015 May;23(2):110-5. doi: 10.1177/1742271X14567498. Epub 2015 Jan 10.
